questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have an Azure subscription that contains a highly available SAP NetWeaver deployment. The deployment contains four virtual machines.

You need to monitor the NetWeaver deployment by using Azure Monitor for SAP Solutions. During the implementation of Azure Monitor for SAP Solutions, downtime of the deployment must be minimized.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
according to this link:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sap/monitor/provider-netweaver

I would go
1. Change profile
2. Restart sapsrvsvc
3. Azure Monitor for SAP configure NetWeaver

The question is not completely formulated , possible answer: 
1.From the Azure portal, deploy the Azure Monitor for SAP Solutions managed resource group and configure NetWeaver provider.
2.From the SAP GUI, connect to SAP system and modify the instance profiles
3.From SAP Management console restart the sapstartsrv service 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sap/monitor/quickstart-portal
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sap/monitor/provider-netweaver
DisksPD is from microsoft and it works only on windows, the right answer is FIO

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an SAP on Azure landscape.

You need to gather the following metrics:

• The network latency between an SAP NetWeaver server and an SAP HANA server.
• The throughput and latency of the storage subsystem on Windows Server and Linux platforms.

What should you use for each metric? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To monitor the storage usage of the Azure SAP HANA (Large Instances) instance HLI1, specifically the number of stored snapshots and the storage used by the snapshots, the most appropriate Linux OS command is:

C. du

The 'du' (disk usage) command in Linux provides information about the amount of disk space used by files and directories. You can use it to check the storage consumed by the snapshot directories, giving you an insight into both the number of snapshots (by counting the directories) and the total space they are using. Remember to navigate to the specific directory where snapshots are stored before running the 'du' command.
ls can not give disk usage , du is right option.

The correct answer is C .....du command.

Please check the link below from Redhat

https://www.redhat.com/sysadmin/du-command-options

questions.question_text:
You have an instance of Azure SAP HANA (Large Instances) named HLI1 that has storage volume snapshots enabled.

You need to monitor the storage usage of HLI1. The solution must monitor the following:

• The number of stored snapshots
• The storage used by the snapshots

Which Linux OS command should you use?

discussion.content: Instance is 03, so the port should be 30315

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
